intro: Cacalia remotiflora, commonly known as the distant-flowered cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Cacalia remotiflora is known for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
